Event.0: Roman Emperor Diocletian begins his policy of persecuting Christians, razing the church at Nicomedia
Event.1: Actor Paul Rudd (33) weds publicist Julie Yaeger
Event.2: "Blue" country and pop singer LeAnn Rimes (19) weds backup dancer Dean Sheremet (21) at Perkins Chapel in Dallas, Texas
Event.3: Mexican-born American musician Carlos Santana won eight Grammy Awards for Supernatural, tying the record set by Michael Jackson.
Event.4: Osama bin Laden publishes a fatwa declaring jihad against all Jews and Crusaders
Event.5: "Trainspotting" directed by Danny Boyle based on the book by Irvine Welsh, starring Ewan McGregor, Robert Carlyle and Jonny Lee Miller opens in cinemas in the UK and Ireland
Event.6: US Governor Jeb Bush (21) weds philantropist Columba Bush (20) in Austin, Texas
Event.7: Wilt Chamberlain becomes 1st NBAer to score 25,000 points
Event.8: British-born comedian Stan Laurel, of the comedy team Laurel and Hardy, died in Santa Monica, California.
Event.9:
Michael Dell
American business executive
was born
Event.10: Luciano Pavarotti makes his debut at the Vienna State Opera in "La traviata"
Event.11:
Naruhito
crown prince of Japan
was born
Event.12: 1st mass inoculation against polio with Salk vaccine (Pittsburgh)
Event.13: US Marines raise American flag on top of Mt. Suribachi, Iwo Jima. Photo of which by Joe Rosenthall later became iconic, inspiring the Marine Corps War Memorial sculpture
Event.14: Six U.S. servicemen raised the American flag over Mount Suribachi on the island of Iwo Jima during World War II.
Event.15: The first Rotary Club was founded by Chicago attorney Paul P. Harris.
Event.16: United States acquires control of the Panama Canal Zone for $10 million
Event.17:
Kazimir Malevich
Russian painter
was born
Event.18: Mississippi was readmitted to the United States following the American Civil War.
Event.19:
Alamo besieged by Santa Anna's Mexican army
This day in 1836, during the Texas war for independence, Mexican General Antonio López de Santa Anna began a siege of the Alamo, which was captured after 13 days and which became for Texans a symbol of heroic resistance.
Event.20: Alamo besieged for 13 days until March 6 by Mexican army under General Santa Anna; entire garrison eventually killed
Event.21: Boston was granted a charter to become a city.
Event.22: Composer George Frideric Handel, a leading figure of late Baroque music, was born in Germany.
Event.23:
George Frideric Handel
German-English composer
was born
Event.24:
Samuel Pepys
English diarist and naval administrator
was born
Event.25: Francisco Vázquez de Coronado's expedition sets off from Mexico in search of the 7 cities of Cibola
Event.26: Johannes Gutenberg prints his first Bible (estimated date)
